intro: Nemesia chrysolopha, commonly known as the golden nemesia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters and prefers well-drained, sandy soils. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens. Nemesia chrysolopha is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
